paragraphs.content: Chapter 17
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 17

paragraphs.content: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

paragraphs.content: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

paragraphs.content: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the Lord trieth the hearts.

paragraphs.content: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

paragraphs.content: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

paragraphs.content: Children’s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Children’s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

paragraphs.content: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

paragraphs.content: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

paragraphs.content: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.

paragraphs.content: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.

paragraphs.content: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

paragraphs.content: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

paragraphs.content: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

paragraphs.content: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

paragraphs.content: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?

paragraphs.content: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

paragraphs.content: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.

paragraphs.content: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

paragraphs.content: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

paragraphs.content: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

paragraphs.content: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

paragraphs.content: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

paragraphs.content: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

paragraphs.content: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

paragraphs.content: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

paragraphs.content: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

paragraphs.content: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
